sample.title: Why Japan‚Äôs Economy Is at a Tipping Point
sample.description:
For 30 years, Japan‚Äôs prices were largely at a standstill. Now, a weak yen is changing everything. Here‚Äôs how consumers and businesses are coping with rising costs, and what it means for the nation‚Äôs economic future.

sample.title: Why Tariff Refunds Might Not Lower Prices
sample.description:
If the Supreme Court rules the tariffs are illegal, the refund process could become a lengthy back-and-forth between courts. Meanwhile, consumers are unlikely to see price drops as businesses deal with cash flow crunches. CNBC's Lori Ann LaRocco breaks down the three likeliest scenarios and why businesses will still be left waiting for their money.

Produced, Shot and Edited by: Charlotte Morabito
Reporting by: Lori Ann LaRocco

sample.title: How Anthropic quietly took on OpenAI
sample.description:
Daniela and Dario Amodei left OpenAI five years ago to form Anthropic.

Anthropic‚Äôs revenue has grown 10x annually for three straight years, with 85% coming from business customers ‚Äî the inverse of OpenAI‚Äôs consumer-heavy model.

sample.title: Why Automakers Want To Power AI Data Centers
sample.description:
With EV sales faltering and forecasts lowered, automakers are looking for ways to sell the batteries they are making. CNBC's Robert Ferris breaks down how and why automakers including General Motors and Ford are investing in a new industry.

sample.title: Who could replace Jamie Dimon as CEO of JPM?
sample.description:
JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has for years maintained that his retirement was perpetually 5 years away. In 2024, for the first time, he acknowledged that window was shrinking.

That makes the inevitable questions surrounding Dimon‚Äôs tenure loom large as he approaches 70 years of age. Will JPMorgan‚Äôs era of dominance be over when Dimon exits as CEO?

sample.title: Why NBCUniversal Is All In On Sports
sample.description:
NBC's upcoming lineup for its ‚ÄúLegendary February‚Äù features some of the biggest sports events in the U.S., including Super Bowl LX, the Winter Olympics and NBA All-Star. The month showcases the media outlet's huge bet on sports. CNBC‚Äôs Alex Sherman breaks it down.

Reporting by: Alex Sherman

sample.title: Why did Trump call the Chagos Islands deal 'an act of great stupidity'? | BBC Newscast
sample.description:
Today, the UK government has defended its decision to hand over the Chagos Islands after US President Donald Trump called the deal ‚Äúan act of GREAT STUPIDITY!‚Äù on Truth Social.  

Adam and Chris put the president‚Äôs comments to Darren Jones, Chief Secretary to the Prime Minister, and ask whether Keir Starmer‚Äôs relationship with Donald Trump is being tested by his social media posts.  

And, we hear Darren Jones‚Äô vision for reforming the civil service, including a digital state and changing following a speech he gave on Tuesday morning at a London tech company.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews

sample.title: How Donald Trump reshaped the world in a year | Global News Podcast
sample.description:
When US President Donald Trump returned to the White House for a second term, he promised a "Golden Age of America".  
 
And a year on, he‚Äôs been flexing his political muscles around the world and at home.

Has he changed the nature of the American presidency forever? 
 
Our Washington correspondent Gary Donoghue reflects on global impact of the president's bold promises and how they are playing with his Maga base.
 
Subscribe to the Global News Podcast wherever you get your podcasts or find more episodes here: https://bbc.in/GlobalNewsPodcast
 
#DonaldTrump #TrumpOneYear #BBCNews

sample.title: Brooklyn Beckham's bombshell claims in feud with family | BBC News
sample.description:
A six-page Instagram post by Brooklyn Beckham on Monday night, laid out in detail his angst against his parents, Sir David and Lady Beckham.
 
He claimed his mother had "hijacked" the first dance at his wedding, which - he says - had been planned "weeks in advance" to a romantic love song.
 
Elsewhere in the post, Brooklyn accused his parents of trying to derail their wedding, claiming his fashion designer mother had "cancelled making Nicola's dress in the eleventh hour despite how excited she was to wear her design, forcing her to urgently find a new dress".
 
The Beckhams have yet to respond.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews

sample.title: Trump says 'no going back' on Greenland plan | The Global Story Podcast
sample.description:
President Donald Trump says he's going to tell world leaders at the World Economic Forum in Davos this week that the United States "has to have" Greenland.

But why has Greenland become so important in his thinking? 

Trump says he will, "100%" follow through on his threats to impose tariffs if a deal over Greenland is not reached, and responded, "no comment" on Monday when asked whether he would use force to seize the island.

Even if Trump‚Äôs attempt to control Greenland goes no further, has trust between the United States and its Nato allies been damaged beyond repair? 

Tristan Redman speaks to the BBC‚Äôs World News correspondent, Joe Inwood.

New episodes of The Global Story are released daily. If you‚Äôre in the UK, listen on BBC Sounds. If you live outside the UK, listen on BBC.com or wherever you get your podcasts. 
https://link.mgln.ai/the-global-story...
